verb.description: (of a liquid or semiliquid substance) set or become more solid.
examples: she works at it all day but can't get the jelly to jell
chicken or fish stock will jell when chilled

verb.description: (of a project or idea) take a definite form or begin to work well.
examples: he decided to do a different film that would jell at the box office

origin: Mid 18th century: back-formation from jelly. See also gel.
